item.meaning: Module Boucle DEFNet : controls up to 4 lines OR 2 loops. MBD Board will communicate with devices, using the DEFNet protocol
Module Boucle TNet : controls up to 6 lines OR 3 loops. MBT Board will communicate with devices, using the TNet protocol
Element present on a MBD/MBT line or loop. This element can be a Point (ECS element) or a Deported Element (CMSI element)
MPE is ELITE motherboard and achieving majority of functions (Manage and interface the LCD display, Manage Power supply, Manage I/O interface, Manage option and extension board.
MGER is ELITE board. MGER is a communication module for the German market (FAT/FBF, alerting, transmission).
ELOA is ELITE extention board. ELOA use one loop Apollo.
ELOT is ELITE extention board. ELOT use one loop T-NET.
ELIC is ELITE extention board. ELIC use 2 conventional lines.
ELIS is ELITE extention board. ELIS use 2 sounder lines.
EUGA is ELITE extention board. EUGA uses 1 sounder line and 1 relay.

documentation.brief: PAS version used on this board
Current board hardware PCB main version
Current consumption on digital power supply rail in mA
Digital power supply rail voltage in mV
Current board temperature in celcius degree
Link between index and PDO list
Use internal channel (Boards inside the equipment only)
Use functional list (all equipment from same function (CMSI/ECS/...))
Flag to synchronize Objects Dictionary : when a module received this subindex change, it must resend all its producted PDO
Flag to synchronize time from SNTP. Time-master MGG sends this trigger, in other MGG, force sntp synchronisation (unicast to MGG master and broadcast to MXX cards)
Flag to reset the activation (command) state of MXX cards. When MXX received this trigger, it must resend command state to the board
Flag to ask a MGG to send indenfication SDO to board if sender is in its DDS
Flag to ask a MGG to broadcast its tOD_CRCEqChange_t object
Shift between UTC time and real time
signed value holds timespan between UTC time and local time in second unit. Real time = UTC time + timespan

RIDXCalculation.rule: From 0000 to 7FFF, indexes concern CMSI type devices
From 8000 to FFFF, indexes concern ECS type devices
Reduced indexes are defined in tDDS_DeviceInfo_t objects, field u16ReducedPASIndex

documentation.brief: Raw device state, produced by MBD/MBT/M8IO/M10R... boards
documentation.remarks:
Indexes are split into 2 groups :
from 0000 to 7FFF included
CMSI devices
from 8000 to FFFF included
ECS devices
This is a logical separation. Nothing request this split...

documentation.brief: Board type which must be present in all slot from 0 to 14
documentation.remarks: For A5 equipment, eboard_slot[0] should be set to ePAS_CARD_FAFP
For A5 equipment, eboard_slot[1] should be set to ePAS_CARD_MGG
For Elite equipment, eboard_slot[1] should be set to ePAS_CARD_MPE
When no boards is supposed to be present in the given slot, ePAS_CARD_UNKNOWN is expected

documentation.brief: Indicates if EAES 1 and EAES 2 are used.
documentation.remarks: xEAES_Used bit 0 should be set if EAES1 is used, if not it should be clear
xEAES_Used bit 1 should be set if EAES2 is used, if not it should be clear
Depends on the value of ::tDDS_EqInfo_t::eType subindex

documentation.brief: IP address of the Inet board which is SNTP master
documentation.remarks: The IP address must be 10.EqType.EqID.slot*10+subslot

documentation.brief: Array to describe the type of the board inserted in the subslot #n of the slot #p
documentation.remarks: Below is presented an example showing how this scheme works:
* A first ELOT board in the SubSlot #1 of the MPE board in Slot #1 => {01 / 01 / ePAS_CARD_ELOT} for first item of the array
* An ELIS board in the SubSlot #2 of the MPE board in Slot #1 => {01 / 02 / ePAS_CARD_ELIS} for second item of the array
* Another ELOT board in the SubSlot #3 of the MPE board in Slot #1 => {01 / 03 / ePAS_CARD_ELOT} for third item of the array
* No more board in any other SubSlot of any other Slot => {00 / 00 / ePAS_CARD_UNKNOWN} for all remaining items of the array

Resistance threshold for battery in ohm * 1000. Parameter value can be set between 50 and 1000 (0.05 and 1)
Pre-Cut threshold voltage in volt * 100. Parameter value can be set between 2000 and 2700 (20V and 27V)
Battery low threshold in volt * 100. Parameter value can be set between 2000 and 2700 (20V and 27V)
DEPRECATED. NOT USED BY MEAES. Battery loss threshold in volt * 100. Parameter value can be set between 2000 and 2700 (20V and 27V)
Time before battery loss in minute. Parameter value can be set between 16 and 240 (16 minutes and 4 hours).
Time before battery low in minute. Parameter value can be set between 0 and 20 (0 minute and 20 minutes).
Filter for resistance verification. N * 16 minutes. Parameter value can be set between 1 and 60 (16 minutes and 16 hours)
DEPRECATED. NOT USED BY MEAES.Time before charger loss verification. Parameter value can be set between 1 and 60 (1 minute and 1 hour)
Battery capacity in Ah * 10. Parameter value can be set between 20 and 500 (2Ah and 50Ah)
Maximum Output current for VAux1 in A*1000. Parameter value can be set between 1500 and 2100 (1,5A and 2,1A)
Maximum Output current for VAux2 in A*1000. Parameter value can be set between 1500 and 2100 (1,5A and 2,1A)
Maximum Output current for VBoucle in A*1000. Parameter value can be set between 1800 and 2300 (1,8A and 2,3A)
Maximum Output current for VIO in A*1000. Parameter value can be set between 4000 and 4650 (4A and 4,65A)
Maximum Output current for VDigital in A*1000. Parameter value can be set between 1000 and 1600 (1A and 1,6A)
Value is 0 to select 1,26A charging current. Value is 1 to select 2A charging current.
Time in minutes to set mains absent fault signalization. Parameter value can be set between 1 and 30 (1 minute and 30 minutes)
Threshold of min voltage to start auto test (in volt * 100). Parameter value can be set between 2300 and 2800 (23V and 28V)
Threshold of min voltage to keep auto test active (in volt * 100). Parameter value can be set between 2300 and 2800 (23V and 28V)

documentation.brief: RS485 channel label of main board

documentation.brief: Reduced PAS Index of the device concerned by this label
This value indicates how many children a virtual device have
documentation.remarks: If the given device is not a virtual device (for instance, an ED4L), u8Children must be set to 0
Device's children Indexes must directly follow the virtual device (parent)

documentation.brief: This field is used to indicates which tDDS_LBL_DeviceType_t should be read to get Device label and Icon. (ED4L for instance, does not have a tDDS_DeviceInfo_t object)
Device type icon to display on FAFP
documentation.description: This icon must be uploaded into the FAFP board if the icon does not exists yet.

documentation.brief: This field indicates the view/control category of this point in FAFP
Device type model - this model will be used to define all devices

documentation.remarks: By default, eIdent1_Dwnld should be equal to eIdent1 (for instance : EDL, ED4L, EDR2E, ED4R, EDA, MDADAPT, ETCO, MBASV)
By default, eIdent2_Dwnld should be equal to eIdent2 (for instance : EDL, ED4L, EDR2E, ED4R, EDA, MDADAPT, ETCO, MBASV)

documentation.brief: type de telechargement, voir page 41 SwRS2846 09 13 (0: aucun, 1: type DEFNET C, 2: type DEFNET D)
Type de traitement de l'encrassement (0: aucun 1: ??? Innova)
Nombre de verification immediates a effectuer avant prise en compte d'un signal d'alarme

documentation.description: Describe each device IO, IO per IO. If a device (ie an EDL) has 1 output,2 inputs and 2 PSI then eIOType[0] = [an input type];eIOType[1] = [an input type];eIOType[2] = [an output type];eIOType[3] = [PSI type];eIOType[4] = [PSI type];

documentation.brief: Device type model - this model will be used to define IOR devices

documentation.description: Describe each device IO, IO per IO. If a device (ie an EDL) has 1 output,2 inputs then eIOType[0] = [an input type];eIOType[1] = [an input type];eIOType[2] = [an output type];

documentation.brief: Icon ID. Icon is a 54x54 PNG. The icon is downloded in a separated file

documentation.description: Describe each device IO, IO per IO. Can precise the output type in the given channel type

documentation.brief: Define if the device use behavior management
Icon ID. Icon is a 54x54 PNG. The icon is downloded in a separated file

documentation.description: Describe each device IO, IO per IO. Can precise the output type in the given channel type

documentation.brief: Define how to decode input state

documentation.description: Bit to set to command the output [0;2]; 255 if unused

RIDXCalculation.rule: RIDX must be grouped by MBD board
First RIDX of a group must be written into the proper tDDS_SlotInfoMBD_t.xFirstDeviceConfigRIDX subindex
Number of RIDX of a group must be written into the proper tDDS_SlotInfoMBD_t.u16DeviceTotal subindex
All RIDX in a group MUST be concurrent

documentation.brief: Device SSD. Device can be : - filebus device - Module IO (MPE / M8IO / M10R / M4EVAC / etc...

documentation.description: General description of the device (ie : EDL, BD, EDR, ... )
documentation.remarks: Defnet: table @0x50000
IOR : table @0x50200
T-Net : table @0x50300
Apollo : table @0x50500

documentation.description: Data to be download to the device.

documentation.brief: Device Reduced PAS index used to identify the dynamic object, which contains the given device state
documentation.remarks: For a CMSI, xDeviceRIDX must be from 0x0000 to 0x7FFF.
For an ECS, xDeviceRIDX must be from 0x8000 to 0xFFFF.
Not applicable for IOR devices

documentation.description: DEFnet and Tnet field buses use address to comunicate with devices
documentation.remarks: DEFNet address range is 1 -252
TNet range is 1 -500
For devices which are not taken from field bus (ie IOs) value must be set to 0

documentation.description: Point to tDDS_DeviceInput_t
documentation.remarks: If device has no input, set to 0xFFFF

documentation.description: Point to tDDS_DeviceOutput_t
documentation.remarks: If device has no output, set to 0xFFFF

documentation.brief: Device SSD CRC. This value is used when a device start to check its integrity.

documentation.remarks: T-Net devices can have up to 4 group address
DEFNet devices can have up to 2 group address
Unused for other devices
T-Net : table @0x61000
@0 if not use

documentation.description: If no more device definition bounded to the given board, a value of 0xFFFF is expected (which is invalid)
Each EDBDA has 4 BDA line. Each used line has a unique line number on SMSI.
documentation.remarks: Value must be set for BDA defined on EDBDA line. Otherwise, value must be set to 0xFFFF.

documentation.description: From 0 to 15
documentation.remarks: Value must be set for BDA defined on EDBDA line. Otherwise, value must be set to 0xFF.

documentation.brief: Device input number has describs in the device Datasheet
documentation.remarks: If the device is an IOR device, u8OutputNumber is the IO number on the board

documentation.brief: On which Device IOSet RIDX the Output is set.
documentation.description:
For a device, the first 5 input/ouput are associated to a Device RIDX, and xIORIDX field is set to 0xFFFF. All next 5 input/output are associated to a Device IOSet RIDX and xIORIDX must be set.


Example : In a simple I-NET, an M10R board is set with one device made of 10 relays.
 -For relays 1 to 5, xIORIDX field from tDDS_Output_t, has the value for unused IOSet object, 0xFFFF.
 -For relays 5 to 10, xIORIDX field from tDDS_Output_t, can be set to 'n' (which n is the actual IOSet RIDX) 
 If we add a second M10R board with one device made of 10 relays. 
 -For relays 1 to 5, xIORIDX field from tDDS_Output_t, has the value for unused IOSet object, 0xFFFF.
 -For relays 5 to 10, xIORIDX field from tDDS_Output_t, can be set to n+1.
documentation.remarks: IOSet RIDX is unique

documentation.brief: surveillance de l'entree (non utilise en defnet)
The input needs to command the alarm backup
fonction fin de course ou debut de course + output associe
If this bool is set, xPrimaryThresholds are used for Day periode, xSecondaryThresholds for Night periode.

documentation.description:
This value is the Reduced PAS Index of the tDDS_IOThresholdSet_t object to use.
This value must be filled only if xConfig of the given input is NOT set to eIO_TYPE_UNUSED.

documentation.brief: Secondary threshold set to use. This value is the Reduced PAS Index of the @@obj_0090::name@@ object to use.

documentation.brief: On which Device IOSet RIDX the Output is set.
documentation.description:
For a device, the first 5 input/ouput are associated to a Device RIDX, and xIORIDX field is set to 0xFFFF. All next 5 input/output are associated to a Device IOSet RIDX and xIORIDX must be set.


Example : In a simple I-NET, an M10R board is set with one device made of 10 relays.
 -For relays 1 to 5, xIORIDX field from tDDS_Output_t, has the value for unused IOSet object, 0xFFFF.
 -For relays 5 to 10, xIORIDX field from tDDS_Output_t, can be set to 'n' (which n is the actual IOSet RIDX) 
 If we add a second M10R board with one device made of 10 relays. 
 -For relays 1 to 5, xIORIDX field from tDDS_Output_t, has the value for unused IOSet object, 0xFFFF.
 -For relays 5 to 10, xIORIDX field from tDDS_Output_t, can be set to n+1.
documentation.remarks: IOSet RIDX is unique

documentation.brief: The IDS (output index) is used on T-NET loop. The index is unic on the equipment.

documentation.description: Output DAS : set Stop On End Switch bit to activate option
BD : set DC bit to activate begin switch option

documentation.brief: Filter which determine the time to wait before consider the given output command as completed
Time to wait (in ms) before executing the command for each IO (BD and output)
documentation.remarks: If the given IO is not a BD or an output, this setting must be set to 0

documentation.description:
This value is the Reduced PAS Index of the tDDS_IOThresholdSet_t object to use.

documentation.brief: Section points (elements sur GB) : info telechargees
octet telecharge au point #1 O1 : adresse de groupe 1 (toujours = 1),
octet telecharge au point #2 O2 : adresse de groupe 2 (toujours = 2),
octet telecharge au point #3 surveillance + type E/S / entree (edx) Mode de fonctionnement (orion)
octet telecharge au point #5 retard a la commande
octet telecharge au point #6 duree de la commande
octet telecharge au point #7 filtre d'execution
octet telecharge au point #8 filtre E1/DC
octet telecharge au point #9 filtre E2/DC
octet telecharge au point #10 seuil bas AES
octet telecharge au point #11 seuil haut AES

RIDXCalculation.rule: Reduces indexes from 0 to 31 are on RS485 channel #0 on main board
Reduces indexes from 32 to 63 are on RS485 channel #1 on main board
Reduces indexes from 64 to 95 are on RS485 channel #0 on MPS
Reduces indexes from 96 to 127 are on RS485 channel #1 on MPS

reduced index of the TR status object. This index must be unique on the network

RIDXCalculation.rule: Reduced index 0 is on RS485 channel #0 main board
Reduced index 1 is on RS485 channel #1 main board
Reduced index 2 is on RS485 channel #0 MPS
Reduced index 3 is on RS485 channel #1 MPS

display info : zone user number of the device [if point mode] or zone user number [if jbus zone mode]
